segments.text: If I remember correctly , time of delivery is another point on wich we differ .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's right . Let's go into the details .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Ok . I hope you can have these goods delivered before the end of Sep . We'd like them to be there in time for our Christmas sales .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Christmas doesn't come until almost the end of the year , right ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: But in the United States the Christmas season begins about a month before Dec . 25 .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well . I am afraid it will be difficult for us to advance the time of shipment . Our manufacturers are fully committed at the moment .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I hope you'll try to get them to step up production .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: As new orders keep pouring in , the workers are working three shifts to step up production .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: If that's the case , there is nothing more to be said .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What's your last word as to the date then ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I said by the middle of Oct . This is the best we can promise .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: All right . I'll take you at your word .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Good . Let's call it a deal . We will do our best to advance the shipment , but your L / C should be opened early Sep .
segments.speaker: S2
